content.description: This is a nice upper wall route up a fairly obvious crack/corner feature on the right side to a sweet perch on the summit ridge.
content.location:
This 1-pitch, upper wall line is just right of

Archimedes Says We're Hired

.

content.description:
Step off the boulder and engage technical face and layaway moves that ease past the 4th bolt. This route ends on "Link Ledge" roughly halfway up the wall.

The Piercing

(10c) is a delightful climb to the summit that extends past Straight Arrow.
content.location: Scramble up the large boulder, and start just right of the leftmost tree below the obvious overlaps.

content.description:
This climb offers 2 difficult sections down low, then passes "Link Ledge" (optional belay) and one more difficult section before the climbing eases.

There are Mussy/steel anchor on the summit ridge.

Two rappels are required with a 60m rope.
content.location:
This route is currently the longest single-pitch climb at Sawmill. It starts halfway between the two large trees on the main face. It is right of

Straight Arrow

(12a).

content.description:
5.9 climbing past a bulge (10b) leads past a ledge (optional belay), then work up to a technical crux past crimps, edges, and shallow pockets. The finish tends up and right on incredible holds to an anchor with steel carabiners just below the summit.

This can be done as one pitch.

Two rappels are required with a 60m rope.
content.protection: 22 bolts + links at an optional belay and the summit.
content.location: Scramble up the large boulder to two large trees at the base of the main wall of Sawmill. Rough Sawn takes the line left of the left of these two trees and starts at a tiny left-facing corner with a rock scar. It is the 4th route from the left on this wall.

content.description: Rosewood starts on the face of a shallow dihedral, moves to a small pillar, and finishes with slab climbing to the anchor.
content.location: This route is towards climber's right/eastern part of crag. Start on the face of a shallow dihedral.

content.description:
This is the upper wall extension to

Straight Arrow

(12a), and it climbs up the wall characterized by a small, right-facing corner left of the huge rock scar visible from the ground. The short-lived crux at bolt 3 is followed by fun climbing with a slight jog right then back left where the wall blanks out. There are chains (for now) up top.

Two single rope rappels are required to reach the ground.
content.location:
It is directly above

Straight Arrow

(12a).

content.description:
Right of

Architype

is a thin, ginsu-style flake. Take this delicately to the crux wall above. Climb past the ledge (optional belay), and finish with moderate but fun climbing up the varnished dihedral.

The descent will require two rappels with a 60m rope.
content.location:
It is to the right of

...Barbies...

and

Architype

in the rock corridor.

content.description: Mean, Mean Pride is the final upper wall route. It is cruiser to final roof, then trend left to the anchors.
content.location:
Begin just right of

Worth the Price of Admission

.

content.description:
Cracked Pedestal is the result of too much table dancing ....  The route casually follows the continuous crack system stepping past the short, fist crack bulge. Then trend left through a series of thin, intermittent cracks towards the anchor above

Rosewood

. Alternately, above the short fist crack bulge, it is possible to continue straight up steeper crack and stemming, and finish with a hard traverse left to the

Rosewood

anchor.
content.protection:
Gear to about 4", slings, and shared anchors above

Rosewood

.
content.location: From where Sawmill Crag trail first encounters the wall, walk downhill  to the lowest part of the wall about 30 feet. The route starts in the first continuous crack system just right of the rounded arete at ground level.

content.description: Climb a well-protected first pitch to a small ledge (5.9- 8 bolts...hint: look around). Plentiful edges, a little airiness, and a final small bulge with big hand holds make for fun 5.7 second pitch (6 bolts). You can do two rappels with a single 60m rope.
content.protection: The first pitch has 8 bolts, and the second pitch has 6 bolts.
content.location: Start at the top of the narrow corridor.

content.description: Sustained layaways and face climbing lead to moves past the giant flake (right of the large scar) to a final face and the anchor just below the ridge line.
content.location:
This single pitch line is just right of the upper half of

Saw Monster

.

content.description:
Nice patina leads to a difficult move at the bulge, then continue with more moderate climbing up to a ledge with anchors (optional belay). Climb the steepening wall aiming for a tiny, right-facing corner on the right (crux) past the last bolt to jugs and the anchors.

The descent will require two rappels with a 60m rope.

This route is named in honor of Archibald Staunton. The amazing generosity of the Staunton family make Staunton State Park a possibility.
content.location:
It is towards the top of the corridor, just right of

...Barbies...

.

content.description: Big holds off the ledge lead to a superb crux bulge, then more mundane but still fun climbing heads up to the anchor at the ridgeline.
content.location:
This 1-pitch, upper wall line is just right of

The Big Drop

.

content.description:
This is a second pitch above the

Rosewood

anchor. It has great position. Pass the overhanging corner on good gear and big holds. Above the roof, step onto the headwall, and follow the bolts up the exposed edge of the formation.
content.protection: Finger- to hand-sized gear through overhanging corner then bolts. It has a bolted anchor to rappel. Do 2 rappels with a 60m rope.
content.location:
Start from the anchor above

Rosewood's

anchor. Climb

Rosewood

or

Cracked Pedestal

as a first pitch.
